name: Milk Tart
description: A traditional South African dessert with a sugary crust and sweet, milky custard filling, sprinkled with cinnamon and chilled. This authentic melktert recipe creates two lovely pies with a cookie-like crust and smooth custard.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 1
recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

recipeInstructions.name: Step 2
recipeInstructions.text: In a medium mixing bowl, cream together 1/2 cup butter or margarine and 1 cup sugar. Add 1 egg and beat until mixture is smooth. In a separate bowl, mix together 2 cups flour, baking powder, and salt. Stir flour mixture into sugar mixture just until ingredients are thoroughly combined. Press mixture into bottom and sides of two 9-inch pie pans.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 3
recipeInstructions.text: Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 15 minutes, until golden brown.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 4
recipeInstructions.text: In a large saucepan, combine milk, vanilla extract, and 1 tablespoon butter or margarine. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then remove from burner.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 5
recipeInstructions.text: In a separate bowl, mix together 2 1/2 tablespoons flour, cornstarch, and 1/2 cup sugar. Add beaten eggs to sugar mixture and whisk until smooth. Slowly whisk mixture into milk. Return pan to heat and bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Boil and stir 5 minutes. Pour half of mixture into each pastry shell. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Chill before serving.
